Question: 
History of the United States (1776-89)
1776 1789 united states emerged independent country creating ratifying new constitution establishing national government order assert traditional rights american patriots seized control colonies launched war independence americans declared independence july 1776 proclaiming "all men created equal" congress raised continental army command general george washington forged military alliance france captured two main british invasion armies nationalists replaced governing articles confederation strengthen federal government's powers defense taxation constitution united states 1789 still effect today
Question: 
 Background

 Invasion of Canada 
winter 177576 attempt patriots capture quebec failed buildup british forces halifax nova scotia precluded colony joining 13 colonies americans able capture british fort ticonderoga new york drag cannon snow outskirts boston appearance troops cannon dorchester heights outside boston led british army evacuate city march 17 1776
Question: 
 Declaration of Independence 
july 2 1776 second continental congress still meeting philadelphia voted unanimously declare independence "of thirteen united states america" two days later july 4 congress adopted declaration independence drafting declaration responsibility committee five included among others john adams benjamin franklin drafted thomas jefferson revised others congress whole contended "all men created equal" "certain unalienable rights among life liberty pursuit happiness" "to secure rights governments instituted among men deriving powers consent governed" well listing main colonial grievances crown july 4 would subsequently celebrated birthday united states
Question: 
 Campaigns of 1776 and 1777 
british returned force august 1776 landing new york defeating fledgling continental army battle long island one largest engagements war quickly seized new york city nearly captured general washington army british made city main political military base operations north america holding late 1783 patriot evacuation british military occupation made city destination loyalist refugees focal point washington's intelligence network british soon seized new jersey american fortunes looked dim thomas paine proclaimed "these times try men's souls" washington struck back surprise attack crossing icy delaware river new jersey defeated british armies trenton princeton thereby regaining new jersey victories gave important boost patriots time morale flagging become iconic images warin early 1777 grand british strategic plan saratoga campaign drafted london plan called two british armies converge albany new york north south dividing colonies two separating new england rest failed communications poor planning resulted army descending canada commanded general john burgoyne bogging dense forest north albany meanwhile british army supposed advance hudson river meet burgoyne went instead philadelphia vain attempt end war capturing american capital city burgoyne's army overwhelmed saratoga swarming local militia spearheaded cadre american regulars battle showed british considered colonials ragtag mob could easily dispersed americans strength determination fight said one british officerthe courage obstinacy americans fought astonishment everyone became fully convinced contemptible enemy hitherto imagined incapable standing regular engagement would fight behind strong powerful worksthe american victory saratoga led french open military alliance united states treaty alliance 1778 france soon joined spain netherlands major naval powers interest undermining british strength britain faced major european war involvement french navy neutralized previous dominance war sea britain without allies faced prospect invasion across english channel

Question: 
 Declaration of Independence 
july 2 1776 second continental congress still meeting philadelphia voted unanimously declare independence "of thirteen united states america" two days later july 4 congress adopted declaration independence drafting declaration responsibility committee five included among others john adams benjamin franklin drafted thomas jefferson revised others congress whole contended "all men created equal" "certain unalienable rights among life liberty pursuit happiness" "to secure rights governments instituted among men deriving powers consent governed" well listing main colonial grievances crown july 4 would subsequently celebrated birthday united states
